message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.RO 

Reasoning: The paper discusses a framework for active sensing that involves Bayes-optimal inference and control. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) or artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper uses simulations on a visual search task, which suggests that it may also belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The paper also discusses the role of active sensing in computational neuroscience, which suggests that it may belong to the neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the geometric properties of the C-DAC policy, which suggests that it may also belong to the robotics (cs.RO) sub-category.
